segments.text: I think about how children can be so fearless, climbing on things that seem unsafe to adults.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the girl raises her hand toward the boy is almost poetic; it’s like they are in their own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I feel a knot of tension in my stomach as I watch the boy inch closer to the edge of the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can the woman not see the water pouring over the sink? It’s like watching a slow-motion disaster unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink’s overflow is such a trivial thing, yet it has the potential to turn everything upside down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hear the cheerful sound of the water, but it feels more like a warning bell to me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their laughter fills the air, and for a moment, I can’t help but feel joy in their innocent adventure.
segments.speaker: PAR
